revised_title: Intra-Cellular Ice Formation and Viability of Mammalian Cells
tldr: The author discusses the formation of intra-cellular ice in mammalian cells and tissues during freezing. They observe that some cells, like Craigie's paramorphic cells, are more resistant to freezing and show fewer ice-crystal spaces. The author suggests that this resistance could help determine which cells are more likely to survive freezing and be viable for transplantation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
